issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method `checkOrderReady()` with no parameters, but the solution implements `public void checkOrderReady(boolean enableLogging)` and omits the parameterless version. This mismatch in method signature can confuse students about which method to implement and call.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the solution to define `public void checkOrderReady()` (no parameters) that contains the order‐serving logic, and optionally have it delegate to a private helper if logging is needed. Ensure calls use the no‐arg `checkOrderReady()` to match the specification.
